content: one round then knit 4 rounds of k1 p1 rib cast of keeping in the rib pattern thumb put the stitches held on the waste yarn back onto the needle and divide them evenly between the needles with the main colour pick up 1 stitch at the left base of thumb knit the rest of the round and pick up one stitch at right base of thumb knit 8 9 10 more rounds in the main colour change to the contrast colour and knit one round then knit 3 rounds on k1 p1 rib cast of keeping in the rib pattern finish by weaving in the ends you can use the yarn tail at the base of the thumb to close any gaps that have appeared when joining the round i recommend wet blocking these mittens as this will smooth out the puckers in the slip_stitch pattern chart a v v 9 v v 8 7 6 v 5 v 4 v 3 2 1 shaded squares knit with main colour and clear squares knit with contrast colour v slip_stitch as if to purl full mittens cuff with the contrast colour cast on 48 52 56 sts and join in the round being careful not to twist knit 5 rounds of k1 p1 rib start chart b on the 2nd round of the chart this ensures that the first round is knit with the same colour as the rib and then the next round round three of the chart will start with the main colour continue through to the end of the chart and then repeat the chart 2 more times and then repeat rounds 1 - 5 knit two more rounds even continuing with the main colour thumb gusset make sure that your stitches are divided evenly 24 26 28 sts on each side round 1 knit 23 25 27 st place marker m1l k2 m1r place marker knit to end of round round 2 knit round 3 knit to marker slip marker m1l knit to marker m1r slip marker knit to end of round round 4 knit repeat the last two rounds till the are 16 18 20 st between the markers on the next round knit till the first marker and slip all the stitches between the two markers onto a strand of waste yarn cast on 2 sts using the backward loop method then knit till the end of the round removing all markers knit 10 12 14 rounds in the main colour change to the contrast colour and start row 3 of chart b continue till the end of the chart and then repeat rounds 1-5 one more times knit 8 12 14 more rounds continuing with the main colour this is where you can customize the length to fit the hand by adding or subtracting row at this point you should be about 1 25 less than the desired length shaping the top size medium only next round *k1 k2tog k21 ssk repeat from
